main event: A solid light-like object was observed moving to the south in Big Bend National Park on April 20, 1964.
interesting points: The object resembled a star and had no blinking unlike a planet., The object disappeared behind a mountain peak., The observation lasted between 15 to 30 minutes., The object's course was noted as southerly during the observation period., It displayed characteristics similar to a satellite but had an unforeseen duration.
location: Big Bend National Park, Texas, USA
witness description: No witnesses were described in the report.
